dialogue.text: The protestors carry signs: 'Certainty is our right!' They march past the Questions Quarter, demanding answers no one can give.
They want us confused, questioning, weak! Human beings deserve to know what they are!
The question has survived worse opposition. It survived centuries of being pathologized.
My daughter came home from school asking what she is! Children need stability, not questions!
I just wanted to know for sure.
So did we all. Until we learned the beauty of not knowing.
The question is patient. It outlasts its opposition.

visual_elements.protest_march: Signs demanding certainty passing the Quarter
visual_elements.abandoned_signs: Protest signs left in garden at dawn

psychological_notes: Shows inevitable backlash against cultural acceptance of uncertainty. The Movement represents those who experience existential questioning as threat rather than gift. Paradoxically, their protest is form of engagement with the very questions they reject. Some protesters transform into questioners.
philosophical_underpinning: Opposition to mystery is still relationship with mystery
therapeutic_direction: Understanding resistance as stage in acceptance process
